content: {"tips":["Balance service with continued self-care and healing","Start small and build your service capacity gradually","Connect with others doing similar service work for support","Remember: you cannot pour from an empty cup","Your service work should energize you, not drain you"],"instructions":["Develop concrete steps for beginning to live your purpose","Create realistic timelines and goals for purposeful action","Identify resources and support needed for your purpose journey","Plan how to balance purpose work with self-care and continued healing"],"neuroscience":"Goal-setting and planning activate the prefrontal cortex and create neural templates for action. When purpose goals are specific and meaningful, they engage both motivation and executive function networks, increasing likelihood of follow-through.","timeEstimate":"40-45 minutes","planningAreas":{"support":"What resources, training, or support do you need to succeed?","immediate":"What can you do in the next 30 days to begin living your purpose?","long_term":"What is your vision for purposeful living in 1-2 years?","short_term":"What goals will you work toward in the next 3-6 months?"}}

title: Phoenix Legacy Visioning
description: Envision the lasting impact you want to create through your Phoenix transformation
content: {"tips":["Legacy thinking helps clarify what really matters to you","Your legacy starts with how you impact people today","Small actions can have generational impact","Legacy is about contribution, not achievement","Your healing journey can be part of your legacy"],"legacyAreas":{"global":"How might your story and gifts serve people beyond your immediate circle?","personal":"How do you want your healing to impact your immediate relationships?","community":"What contribution do you want to make to your local community?","generational":"What legacy do you want to leave for future generations?"},"instructions":["Visualize the legacy you want to create from your healing journey","Consider how your transformation can inspire and help others","Explore what you want to be remembered for and known for","Connect with the ripple effects of your Phoenix purpose"],"neuroscience":"Legacy thinking activates the default mode network and autobiographical memory systems, helping integrate past experiences with future aspirations. Visualizing positive impact on others stimulates reward centers and strengthens motivation for meaningful action.","timeEstimate":"35-40 minutes"}

title: Service Readiness Assessment
description: Assess your readiness to step into service and identify areas for continued growth
content: {"variations":["Start with readiness self-assessment questionnaires","Get feedback from trusted mentors or therapists","Practice serving others in small, low-pressure ways","Join peer support or volunteer organizations","Develop a personal mission statement for service"],"instructions":["Honestly assess your current readiness for purposeful service","Identify areas where you feel strong and confident","Recognize areas that need continued healing or development","Create a self-care plan to support your service work"],"neuroscience":"Self-assessment activates metacognitive networks and the anterior cingulate cortex, supporting honest self-reflection. Identifying both strengths and growth areas creates balanced neural representations that support sustainable service.","timeEstimate":"30-35 minutes","readinessAreas":{"support":"How strong are your support systems for your own continued healing?","triggers":"How aware and prepared are you for potential triggers in service work?","emotional":"How stable and regulated is your emotional state?","boundaries":"How well can you maintain healthy boundaries while helping others?"}}

title: Phoenix Method Integration and Service
description: Integrate all phases of your journey and commit to serving others
content: {"instructions":["Review your entire Phoenix Method journey and transformation","Identify how each phase has prepared you for purposeful service","Create commitments for continued growth and service","Design support systems for your ongoing Phoenix journey"],"neuroscience":"Integration activates multiple brain networks simultaneously, creating cohesive neural representations of growth. When we commit to service, it activates prosocial brain networks and releases oxytocin, supporting both wellbeing and connection to others.","timeEstimate":"35-40 minutes","integrationAreas":{"growth":"How will you continue growing while serving others?","commitment":"What specific commitments are you ready to make for service?","preparation":"How has each phase prepared you for meaningful service?","transformation":"How have you transformed through each phase of the Phoenix Method?"}}

title: Phoenix Rising Celebration
description: Celebrate your transformation and commit to your Phoenix purpose
content: {"prompts":["How do you want to honor and celebrate your Phoenix transformation?","What are you most proud of in your healing and growth journey?","How will you remember this moment when challenges arise?","What commitment are you making to yourself and others as you rise?","How will you continue to embody the Phoenix spirit in your daily life?"],"reflection_areas":{"pride":"Acknowledge the incredible strength and resilience you have shown","future":"Envision yourself as a beacon of hope and healing for others","wisdom":"Recognize the profound wisdom you have gained through your journey","purpose":"Commit to using your gifts and experiences in service of others","gratitude":"Express deep gratitude for your courage to heal and transform"},"celebration_practices":["Write a letter to your future self with your Phoenix commitments","Create a Phoenix symbol or ritual that represents your transformation","Share your story with someone who needs to hear it","Make a formal commitment to your Phoenix purpose and service"]}
